unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: Graduation Gowns
question_text: College graduates purchase their gowns based on their height.  One graduation gown manufacturer measures a sample of graduates to see if it needs to increase its inventory in the taller sizes.  The average height in the random sample of customers was $67\text{ inches}$ with a standard deviation of $4\text{ inches}$ . Which distribution should the manufacturer use to calculate a $95\%$ confidence interval for the average height of its customers?  Why?

choices.text: The z z -distribution should be used because the confidence interval is being constructed for a mean.
The z z -distribution should be used because the confidence interval is being constructed for a proportion.
The t t -distribution should be used because the confidence interval is being constructed for a mean.
The t t -distribution should be used because the confidence interval is being constructed for a proportion.
The chi-square distribution should be used because the confidence interval is being constructed for a proportion.
